interestingFact: Bangladesh is home to the Sundarbans, the largest mangrove forest in the world and habitat of the Royal Bengal Tiger.
Russia is the largest country in the world, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
The U.S. has the world's largest economy.
China is the world's most populous country and has the longest continuous civilization.
India is the largest democracy in the world.
Japan has the highest life expectancy among major countries.
Germany is Europe’s largest economy.
The UK is home to the world’s oldest parliament.
France is the most visited country in the world.
Italy has more UNESCO World Heritage sites than any other country.
Canada has the longest coastline in the world.
Australia is the only continent that is also a country.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the world’s largest rainforest.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria, Bloemfontein, and Cape Town.
Saudi Arabia is home to Mecca, Islam’s holiest city.
Turkey is located on two continents: Asia and Europe.
Spain produces more olive oil than any other country.
Argentina is home to Patagonia and some of the world’s most stunning glaciers.
South Korea has one of the world's fastest internet speeds.
Egypt is home to the Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
